org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event

Class PluginEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.PluginEvent

  • public final class PluginEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    This POJO is used to propagate a change of reader state in an ObservablePlugin.

    A PluginEvent.EventType.READER_CONNECTED event is fired if a new reader is detected and a PluginEvent.EventType.READER_DISCONNECTED event is fired when an already registered reader is removed from the system.

    The getReaderNames() and getEventType() methods allow the event recipient to retrieve the names of the readers involved and the type of the event.

    There are two types of events, the connection and disconnection of readers.

    Since the event provides a list of reader names, a single event can be used to notify a change for one or more readers.

    However, only one type of event is notified at a time.

    Since:
    0.9

      static class  PluginEvent.EventType
      The two types of reader event

    • Constructor Detail

      • PluginEvent

        public PluginEvent(java.lang.String pluginName,
                   java.lang.String readerName,
                   PluginEvent.EventType eventType)
        Create a PluginEvent for a single reader from the plugin and reader names and the type of event.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - A string containing the name of the plugin (should be not null).
        readerName - A string containing the name of the reader (should be not null).
        eventType - An event type PluginEvent.EventType.READER_CONNECTED or PluginEvent.EventType.READER_DISCONNECTED (should be not null).
        Since:
        0.9

      • PluginEvent

        public PluginEvent(java.lang.String pluginName,
                   java.util.Set<java.lang.String> readerNames,
                   PluginEvent.EventType eventType)
        Create a PluginEvent for multiple readers from the plugin name, multiple reader names and the type of event.

        Note: gathering several readers in the same event is always done for a same type of event (e.g. simultaneous disconnection of 2 readers).

        Parameters:
        pluginName - A string containing the name of the plugin (must be not empty).
        readerNames - A set of string containing the reader names (must be not empty).
        eventType - An event type PluginEvent.EventType.READER_CONNECTED or PluginEvent.EventType.READER_DISCONNECTED (must be not null).
        Since:
        0.9

        Gets the name of the plugin to which the reader that generated the event belongs.

      • getReaderNames

        public java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> getReaderNames()
        Gets the names of the readers related to the event in the form of a sorted set.
        Returns:
        A not empty sorted set of strings.
        Since:
        0.9
